title: Lok Sabha Elections 2024: Phase 3 turnout crosses 65%
author: Election Bureau
content:
Phase three of the Lok Sabha elections recorded an impressive turnout exceeding 65% as voters in 93 constituencies headed to the booths. Election officials reported smooth conduct of polling with minimal incidents across states including Gujarat, Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Uttar Pradesh.

Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar praised the voters' enthusiasm and thanked security personnel for maintaining law and order. The final voter turnout figures are expected to be released by evening.
metaDescription: Lok Sabha elections phase 3 sees over 65 percent voter turnout across 93 seats.

title: ISRO readies Gaganyaan abort test ahead of crewed mission
author: Science Desk
content:
ISRO engineers are finalizing preparations for the next Gaganyaan abort test that will validate crew safety systems. The test vehicle is scheduled for launch from Satish Dhawan Space Centre later this month.

The mission will demonstrate the crew escape system's capability to safely eject astronauts during an emergency scenario. ISRO Chairman S. Somanath expressed confidence in meeting the 2025 crewed mission timeline.
metaDescription: ISRO prepares for critical Gaganyaan abort test to validate crew escape systems.

title: Jammu & Kashmir rolls out winter tourism push in Gulmarg
author: Kashmir Bureau
content:
The tourism department unveiled new snow festivals and night skiing packages to attract tourists to Gulmarg this winter. The initiative includes cultural events, adventure sports competitions, and improved infrastructure.

Tourism Minister J&K announced that hotel bookings have surged by 40% compared to last year. The government aims to position Gulmarg as Asia's premier winter destination.
metaDescription: Gulmarg gears up for winter tourism with new snow festivals and night skiing.

title: India's GDP projected to grow 6.5% in FY26, says RBI
author: Economy Desk
content:
The Reserve Bank of India expects steady domestic demand and easing inflation to drive GDP growth of 6.5% in FY26. The projection comes after robust Q3 performance showing 6.7% expansion.

RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das highlighted resilience in manufacturing and services sectors. The bank maintained its repo rate at 6.5% while monitoring global economic uncertainties.
metaDescription: RBI projects India's GDP to expand 6.5% in FY26 on resilient demand.

title: Bollywood star A. Kapoor under ED lens over ad campaign
author: Entertainment Desk
content:
Sources say the Enforcement Directorate has asked for details related to offshore payments for a luxury brand deal. The agency is investigating potential FEMA violations in transactions worth crores.

The actor's legal team maintains full cooperation with authorities. Industry insiders suggest this could impact several pending brand endorsement deals.
metaDescription: Actor A. Kapoor faces ED scrutiny over foreign payments tied to a brand endorsement.

title: India vs Australia: Rohit Sharma backs young pace attack
author: Sports Desk
content:
Skipper Rohit Sharma said the new look pace attack has the confidence to deliver in the upcoming ODI series. The team management has selected three uncapped fast bowlers for the five-match series.

Coach Rahul Dravid emphasized that experience will guide the young guns. The series begins next week at Sydney Cricket Ground.
metaDescription: Rohit Sharma expresses confidence in India's young pace battery ahead of Australia ODIs.

title: Opposition demands debate on MSP bill in Parliament
author: Political Bureau
content:
Farm leaders met key opposition MPs urging an urgent discussion on legal guarantee for MSP. The meeting lasted three hours with leaders from Punjab, Haryana, and UP.

Opposition parties plan to move an adjournment motion demanding immediate debate. The government has maintained that existing MSP mechanisms are functioning effectively.
metaDescription: Opposition MPs push for urgent debate on MSP legislation in Parliament.

title: Indian startups eye semiconductor incentives for fab units
author: Tech Desk
content:
Multiple fabless startups are forming consortiums to qualify for the government's semiconductor mission incentives. The $10 billion scheme offers up to 50% capital subsidy for chip manufacturing.

Industry experts believe this could position India as a key player in the global semiconductor supply chain. Several international players are also exploring joint ventures.
metaDescription: Indian fabless startups plan consortiums to tap the semiconductor mission incentives.

title: US-China trade tensions escalate over chip restrictions
author: World Desk
content:
Trade tensions between US and China intensified as Washington announced new restrictions on advanced chip exports. Beijing called the measures 'economic coercion' and vowed retaliatory actions.

Analysts warn this could disrupt global supply chains affecting electronics manufacturers worldwide. The European Union urged both sides to find diplomatic solutions.
metaDescription: US-China trade tensions rise over semiconductor export restrictions, global supply chains at risk.

title: Europe braces for harsh winter energy crisis
author: World Desk
content:
European nations are preparing contingency plans as natural gas reserves dip ahead of peak winter demand. Germany and France have activated emergency protocols to ensure supply stability.

The EU energy commissioner warned citizens to expect higher utility bills. Renewable energy projects are being fast-tracked to reduce dependence on imported fossil fuels.
metaDescription: Europe prepares for winter energy challenges as gas reserves decline, renewable push accelerates.

title: Middle East peace talks resume after ceasefire extension
author: World Desk
content:
Regional mediators announced the resumption of peace negotiations following a successful 72-hour ceasefire extension. Both parties have agreed to continue discussions under UN supervision.

International observers expressed cautious optimism. The US Secretary of State is scheduled to visit the region next week to facilitate dialogue.
metaDescription: Middle East peace talks restart after ceasefire extension, UN-mediated dialogue continues.

title: Ayodhya Ram Temple inauguration draws massive crowds
author: National Bureau
content:
Lakhs of devotees thronged Ayodhya for the historic Ram Temple consecration ceremony. The event saw participation from dignitaries across political and spiritual spheres.

Security was beefed up with thousands of personnel deployed. The temple trust announced plans for developing the city into a major pilgrimage destination.
metaDescription: Ayodhya Ram Temple consecration ceremony attracts massive turnout, historic moment for devotees.

title: Mumbai Metro expansion phase 2 launches successfully
author: National Bureau
content:
Mumbai Metro's Phase 2 expansion began operations connecting key suburbs to the business district. The new line is expected to reduce commute time by 40% for thousands of daily passengers.

Chief Minister inaugurated the service amid much fanfare. Phase 3 is already in planning stages with environmental clearances underway.
metaDescription: Mumbai Metro Phase 2 launches, connecting suburbs to business district, reducing commute times.
